diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Septic shock due to acute cholecystitis with E. Coli bacteremia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with symptoms including abdominal pain, fever, and decreased urine output. Laboratory findings indicated elevated white blood cell count and lactate levels, consistent with sepsis. Imaging showed gallbladder wall thickening and edema suggestive of acute cholecystitis, leading to the diagnosis of septic shock.
